basics.name: Númi Sveinsson Cepero
basics.label: Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering | Computational Modeling & Medical Imaging
basics.summary: Computational modeling and medical imaging researcher specializing in biofluid dynamics and deep learning for cardiovascular applications. Experienced in developing machine learning frameworks for vessel segmentation and automatic vascular model construction. Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering from the University of California, Berkeley (2025).

education.details: Major: Biomechanics | Minor 1: Machine Learning | Minor 2: Scientific Computing

education.summary: Graduated with the highest GPA in program history.

work.name: University of California, Berkeley — Mechanical Engineering Department
work.summary: Developed deep learning–based methods for automatic vascular model construction and trajectory-oriented vessel tracking in medical imaging. Integrated physics-based modeling and machine learning to enable patient-specific cardiovascular simulations.
highlights: Developed SeqSeg: a deep learning framework for coronary artery segmentation
Created MeshGrow: an automated pipeline for unified cardiac and vascular mesh generation
Contributed to SimVascular open-source cardiovascular modeling software
Mentored undergraduate and MEng teams in medical image analysis projects

work.name: Kerecis
work.summary: Worked on material property analysis for medical biomaterials.
highlights: Collaborated on R&D for regenerative medical materials.

work.name: University of Iceland — Department of Medicine
work.summary: Developed computational models for new lung experimental technologies.

publications.name: SeqSeg: Learning Local Segments for Automatic Vascular Model Construction
publications.summary: N. Sveinsson Cepero and S. C. Shadden. Presents a deep learning method for segmenting and reconstructing vascular models from medical imaging data.

publications.summary: N. Sveinsson Cepero, A. Narayanan, and S. C. Shadden. Introduces MeshGrow, a unified framework for simulation-ready cardiovascular mesh generation.

publications.summary: Ph.D. Dissertation. Explores deep learning for automated vascular model construction.
